data.title: End of an era in Russia as sanctions bite and Western companies take flight
data.description: When thousands of Russians lined up in Moscow's busy Pushkin Square on January 31, 1990 to enter the country's first-ever branch of McDonald's, the moment represented a seismic cultural shift.

data.title: Uber adds fuel surcharge because of high gas prices
data.description: The company said that the fees will go to drivers, who are responsible for paying for gas they use.

data.title: Disney pauses political donations in Florida, CEO apologizes for silence over 'Don't Say Gay' bill
data.description: Disney CEO Bob Chapek apologized for not being a "stronger ally" for the LGBTQ+ community and for the company's silence over Florida's "Don't Say Gay" bill.

data.title: Russia's richest businessman tells Putin: Don't take us back to 1917
data.description: Russia's richest businessman has warned the Kremlin against confiscating assets of companies that have fled in the wake of the invasion of Ukraine, saying such a step would set the country back more than 100 years.

data.title: Russia opens criminal case against Meta following temporary hate speech policy change
data.description: Russia's Investigative Committee has opened a criminal case against Facebook parent company Meta Platforms accusing the company's employees of "illegal calls for murder and violence" against Russian citizens, according to a statement the committee published Friday.

data.title: Meet the company that lets you work remotely from anywhere in the world
data.description: Remote work is becoming more popular, yet a work-from-anywhere job is hard to find. This tech company allows it.

data.author: Mark Chediak
data.title: Ford, PG&E to Test Electric Truck as Power Source for Homes
data.description: Ford, PG&E to Test Electric Truck as Power Source for Homes

data.title: Ford and PG&E partner on electric F-150 powering homes, grid
data.description: Ford will collaborate with Pacific Gas and Electric Co. on the capabilities of the electric F-150 Lightning to power homes and return energy to the power grid.

data.author: Bruce Einhorn
data.title: Japan Inc Joins Russia Exit as Korea, China Companies Remain
data.description: Japan Inc Joins Russia Exit as Korea, China Companies Remain
